a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: The period life expectancy¹ at birth, in a given year.
Data source: UN WPP (2024); HMD (2024); Zijdeman et al. (2015); Riley (2005)
1. Period life expectancy: Period life expectancy is a metric that summarizes death rates across all age groups in one particular year. For a given
year, it represents the average lifespan for a hypothetical group of people, if they experienced the same age-specific death rates throughout their
whole lives as the age-specific death rates seen in that particular year. Learn more in our articles: “Life expectancy” – What does this actually
mean? and Period versus cohort measures: what’s the difference?
